meanings.definition: A function that is both injective and surjective.
meanings.sent1: In mathematics, a bijection ensures that each element in the domain corresponds to exactly one element in the codomain.
meanings.sent2: The bijection between the two sets guarantees a unique pairing for every element.
meanings.sent3: The bijection dance at the math party made sure everyone had a partner.
meanings.sent4: The bijection of colors to numbers was a clever way to represent data.
meanings.sent5: The concept of bijection is like a perfect matching puzzle, where every piece fits exactly once.

meanings.definition: A one-to-one correspondence between two sets.
meanings.sent1: The bijection between the sets ensures that each element has a unique match.
meanings.sent2: The bijection establishes a clear relationship between the elements of the two sets.
meanings.sent3: The bijection picnic seating plan made sure everyone had a designated partner.
meanings.sent4: The bijection of keys to locks was a flawless security system.
meanings.sent5: The idea of bijection is like a perfect pairing, where every item finds its perfect match.
